definition: Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

sentences.english: Those three modern novels are denounced as equally obscene by the wowser .
sentences.chinese: 那三本现代小说均被道学先生们斥为同样猥亵。

sentences.english: The doctor is a very dogmatic puppet .
sentences.chinese: 这个医生是个真正的道学先生。

sentences.english: Wangchuyi should have more of the Sejong taught at the invitation of the palace Road school.
sentences.chinese: 王处一更曾应金世宗的邀请进宫讲授道学。

sentences.english: Without Daoism, Daoless culture will emerge.
sentences.chinese: 没有道学也可以产生无道文化。

sentences.english: A ballistics expert were taking evidence at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 一位弹道学家正在犯法现场提取证据。

sentences.english: Take a camera so you can remember each dish you master.
sentences.chinese: 记得带上摄像机，这样你就能记住每道学过的菜了。

sentences.english: Science to the human mind is what air or water is to the body.
sentences.chinese: 假道学之于人类思想正如空气之于身体。

sentences.english: It is the inevitable requirement of the human world to retrieve the true meaning of Daoism and the spirit of science.
sentences.chinese: 找回道学真义和科学精神是人类世界必然的要求。

sentences.english: A ballistics expert was taking evidence at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 一位弹道学家正在犯罪现场提取证据。

sentences.english: Daoism is the science of how the universe works.
sentences.chinese: 道学是门思索万物运行规律的科学。

sentences.english: Miuccia is always moralistic about these things,' he said.
sentences.chinese: 缪西娅对这些事情总是有些道学气，”他说。

sentences.english: Second, seen from the method of research, Neo-Confucianism is an " argumentative philosophy".
sentences.chinese: 其次，从研究方法看，道学是义理之学。

definition: Confucianism

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
science
study of the Confucian classics
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
Buddhist doctrine/Buddhist studies
scholar/Confucian
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucian
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
profound theory/philosophical theory of Wei and Jin 玄學|玄学 sect
Confucianism
Confucius and Mencius
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
arts of healing, divination, horoscope etc/supernatural arts (old)
